title: Some / Any / No
description: Слушайте и различайте some, any и no в разных контекстах.

tasks.audioText: I went to the shop. I bought some bread and some milk.
tasks.transcript: I bought some bread and some milk.

options.text: The person bought bread and milk.
The person did not buy anything.
The person bought only bread.
The shop had no bread.

tasks.explanation: 'Some' is used in positive sentences to talk about a quantity.

tasks.audioText: I looked in the cupboard. There isn't any sugar left.

options.text: There is a lot of sugar.
The sugar is finished.
There is some sugar in the cupboard.
The person bought sugar.

tasks.explanation: 'Isn't any' means zero quantity — the sugar is gone.

tasks.audioText: We are at the cafe. Would you like some coffee?

options.text: The person is offering coffee.
The person is ordering tea.
There is no coffee at the cafe.
The person does not want coffee.

tasks.explanation: 'Some' is used in offers and polite requests.

tasks.audioText: I checked the parking lot. There are no free spaces today.
tasks.transcript: There are no free spaces today.

options.text: The parking lot has many free spaces.
The parking lot is completely full.
There are some spaces available.
The parking lot is closed.

tasks.explanation: 'No free spaces' means zero spaces — the lot is full.

tasks.audioText: I am thirsty. Is there any water in the fridge?
tasks.transcript: Is there any water in the fridge?

options.text: The person is asking if there is water.
The person says there is no water.
The person has a lot of water.
The person is buying water.

tasks.explanation: 'Any' is used in questions to ask about quantity.

tasks.audioText: I need help with my homework. I have some questions for you.
tasks.transcript: I have some questions for you.

options.text: The person has no questions.
The person wants to ask a few questions.
The person already knows all the answers.
The person is giving answers.

tasks.explanation: 'Some questions' means there are a few questions to ask.

tasks.audioText: I want to buy a gift. I don't have any ideas yet.
tasks.transcript: I don't have any ideas yet.

options.text: The person has many gift ideas.
The person already bought a gift.
The person cannot think of a gift yet.
The person does not want to buy a gift.

tasks.explanation: 'Don't have any' means zero — no ideas at all.

tasks.audioText: I looked everywhere in the office. There is nobody here today.

options.text: The office has many people today.
The office is empty — no people at all.
Some people are in the office.
Everyone is at lunch.

tasks.explanation: 'Nobody' means no person — the office is empty.

tasks.audioText: We had a party last night. Some friends brought food.

options.text: No friends came to the party.
A few friends came with food.
All friends forgot the food.
There was no food at the party.

tasks.explanation: 'Some friends' means a few friends — not all, but more than zero.

tasks.audioText: I asked about the tickets. There aren't any tickets left for Saturday.
tasks.transcript: There aren't any tickets left for Saturday.

options.text: There are still some tickets for Saturday.
All Saturday tickets are sold out.
The tickets are very cheap.
The show is on Sunday.

tasks.explanation: 'Aren't any tickets left' means all tickets are sold — zero remaining.

tasks.audioText: I am at the supermarket. Can I get you some fruit?
tasks.transcript: Can I get you some fruit?

options.text: The person is offering to buy fruit.
The person does not want any fruit.
There is no fruit in the shop.
The person is selling fruit.

tasks.explanation: 'Some' is used in offers: Can I get you some...?

tasks.audioText: I am looking for my keys. There is nothing on the table.
tasks.transcript: There is nothing on the table.

options.text: The table is empty.
The keys are on the table.
Some things are on the table.
The table has food on it.

tasks.explanation: 'Nothing' means zero things — the table has nothing on it.

tasks.audioText: I visited the library yesterday. I found some interesting books there.
tasks.transcript: I found some interesting books there.

options.text: The person found no good books.
The library was closed.
The person found a few good books at the library.
The person returned books to the library.

tasks.explanation: 'Some interesting books' means a few books that were good.

tasks.audioText: I checked the medicine box. We don't have any aspirin at home.
tasks.transcript: We don't have any aspirin at home.

options.text: There is plenty of aspirin at home.
There is no aspirin in the house.
The person bought aspirin.
The person does not need aspirin.

tasks.explanation: 'Don't have any' means there is none — zero aspirin.

tasks.audioText: I need to charge my phone. Are there any sockets near here?
tasks.transcript: Are there any sockets near here?

options.text: The person says there are no sockets.
The person found a socket already.
The person is asking if sockets are available nearby.
The phone battery is full.

tasks.explanation: 'Are there any' is a question asking about availability.

short_description: Some / Any / No: количество в разных типах предложений
